page.title: 09ALONG THE RAILWAY LINE
page.content: On 21st June we went down to the old railway line because there are lots of interesting things to see. There is a disused chimney in the woods that was part of the old mine workings.You can find old bricks down there as well with Clutton stamped on them.Several houses in the village are made of these bricks. We interviewed Mrs.Church about the railway track. She told us that the track by the station was sinking.There were open mines on either side of the track and this was making the ground subside.The trains had to creep through the station. There is also a stone hut along the line where the men kept their tools. The track is now becoming overgrown and lots of wild flowers grow there. Rabbits, foxes and badgers live there.
